article.title: Genomics sheds light on the birth of agriculture
article.teaser: Changing from hunter gathering to a settled farming lifestyle occurred over a period of 7 000 years and started in the Near East, spreading to northern Europe. New genomic evidence has revealed the demographic and migratory processes behind this arguably most revolutionary change in human history.

section.sectionBody:
Around 10 000 years before present (yBP), the migration of human communities across south and central Europe from the Near East introduced farming and animal breeding in Europa, replacing the pre-existing hunter gatherer (HG) way of life with limited interbreeding. By contrast, widespread adoption of farming practices in northern Europe came about mainly as a result of cultural contact, again with restricted gene flow.
The EU-funded NeoGenHeritage project selected the Iberian Peninsula at the western fringe of Europe to study the dynamics and demographic changes of this Neolithic transition. Researchers used this data with the prehistoric routes of migrations that swept across Spain and Portugal and then northwards through Andorra.
Combining cutting edge technologies in ancient DNA remains and human population genomics, NeoGenHeritage researchers generated whole nuclear genome data from prehistoric remains. The next step was to analyse these genomes in the context of ancient and modern population genomics. As Professor Guido Barbujani, project coordinator explains, This approach enabled us to investigate the genetic affinities of ancient north and south Iberian populations in the context of worldwide human genomes.
Bridging the information gaps with state-of-the-art genomic data
Before NeoGenHeritage research, data was scant only one complete Mesolithic genome from around 8 000 yBP and some early and mid-Neolithic remains existed. Limitations with this data are that most of the samples come from northern and central Spain, which prevents comparison of the Atlantic and Mediterranean areas that, as archaeologists tell us, may have different demographies, Prof. Barbujani points out. A further problem was that previously analysis was hampered by a shortage of genetic markers.
NeoGenHeritage therefore designed a sampling strategy to recover contemporary human remains from the Neolithic transition in the Mediterranean and Atlantic areas. Analysis of these complete genomes can detect otherwise elusive differences between the ancient individuals from these two shorelines.
Stepping through the DNA changes along the migration routes
Analyses based on genome wide data support a mixture of cultural and demographic diffusion in both the north and south of the Iberian Peninsula. Genomes of all the post-Neolithic samples have two major components typical of west HGs in Europe and early farmers from the Near East.
However, after running tests for genetic admixture, a biogeographical ancestry analysis, some differences were discernible between the HG populations from the Atlantic and the Mediterranean areas. The samples from the Atlantic side had more in common with the Mesolithic HG from northern Spain.
The simplest explanation for this finding is that the Atlantic and Mediterranean populations of Iberia were already differentiated in pre-Neolithic times, Prof. Barbujani comments. Another reason may be localised admixture between incoming farmers and the pre-existing HG gene pool.
Analysis for future elucidation
Prof. Barbujani describes work that is anticipated to explore and elucidate the complex, dynamic genetic processes at work during the Neolithic Revolution. Continued analysis is going to involve simulation of different levels of genomic diversity with varying evolutionary scenarios and comparison with observed real-life data.
Another option the team would like to pursue is to integrate a similar study on Cheddar Man whose 10 000-year-old remains rose to fame as the first modern Briton with blue eyes, dark to black skin and dark curly hair. This would enable a better understanding of the relationships among European Mesolithic communities.
To sum up the social and genetic aspects of NeoGenHeritage research results, Prof. Barbujani stresses that, Our ancestors have always ventured into new territories, and on their way, they have met and admixed with other populations. The result is a rich patchwork of genomic components, difficult, or impossible, to trace back to a single geographic origin.

article.title: Slinte phoibl: saornaigh a chumas chun monatireacht a dhanamh ar thruailli uirbeach
article.teaser: Sa tionscadal CitieS-Health, arna mhaoini ag an AE, cuirtear bhair imn na saornach i gcrolr an taighde ar an tslinte phoibl agus ar an gcomhshaol uirbeach. Cuirtear bim leis na tortha ar na buntist a bhaineann le bheith pirteach i bpobail itila.

section.sectionBody:
Is fidir le saol na cathrach leas a bhaint as rochtain asca ar dheiseanna fostaochta, gnomhaochta cultrtha agus naisc iompair, ach dfhadfadh roinnt mbhuntist a chruth leis chomh maith. Bonn leibhil nos airde truaillithe aeir agus torainn i dtimpeallachta uirbeacha de ghnth n mar a bhonn i gceantair thuaithe, agus is gnch go mbonn nos l spsanna glasa iontu.
Chun staidar ceart a dhanamh ar thionchar timpeallachta uirbeacha ar an tslinte, n mr dinn a bheith balta nochtadh pearsanta do na tosca riosca sin a mheas, a mhnonn Xavier Basagaa, comhordaitheoir tionscadail https://citieshealth.eu/ (CitieS-Health) (Citizen Science for Urban Environment and Health) Institiid https://www.isglobal.org/en (Barcelona don tSlinte Dhomhanda) sa Spinn. Is fidir leis sin a bheith deacair deolaithe a thomhas astu fin. N mr faisnis thbhachtach amhail gnomhaocht choirp n nsanna pearsanta eile a chur san ireamh freisin.
Mar gheall ar an dshln sin a aithint t pirt nos m glacadh ag saornaigh i dtionscadail uirbeacha eolaochta le cpla bliain anuas, agus iarradh ar an bpobal a bheith rannphirteach i bhfeachtais chun monatireacht a dhanamh ar chilocht an aeir n ar thorann.
Cheapamar, fach, nr baineadh sid iomln as eolaocht na saornach chun an nasc idir nochtadh comhshaoil agus slinte a mheas, a deir Basagaa. Ba sin promhaidhm CitieS-Health.

Seoladh an tionscadal CitieS-Health i m Eanir 2019 agus rechtladh ar fud cig chathair Eorpacha. Cruthaodh staidar difriil i ngach ceann acu, ina drodh ar thopaic a bhaineann leis an tslinte agus an timpeallacht uirbeach: truailli aeir, d bithmhaise, truailli torainn, truailli tionsclaoch agus dearadh uirbeach.
In Barcelona, chuidigh saornaigh le staidar a dhearadh ar an digh ar fidir le truailli dul i bhfeidhm ar an meabhairshlinte. Sholthair thart ar 300 saornach thart ar 2500 tomhas cognaochta agus folline ar laethanta agsla. Cuireadh iad sin i gcomparid ansin le tichan truaillithe aeir ar chuidigh saornaigh le monatireacht a dhanamh orthu, ag baint sid https://www.epa.gov/no2-pollution as feadin phearsanta bailithe (d-ocsade ntrigine).
In Lucca, san Iodil, de thoradh suirbh ar 1025 cnaitheoir in Serchio Valley rinneadh cinneadh dri ar ghalar ainsealach duin. Go dt seo, cuireadh agallamh ar 367 cnaitheoir faoina slite beatha, a n-aiste bia agus a stl mhaireachtla, agus t sampla bitheolaocha tugtha ag 353 acu.
I staidir eile fachadh ar thionchar an torainn ar shlinte (Liiblena, an tSlivin) agus ar dh bithmhaise agus an tslinte (Amstardam, an siltr), chomh maith leis na naisc idir braistint ar chilocht an chomhshaoil, gnomhaocht choirp agus strus (Kaunas, an Liotuin).
I ngach ceann de na cathracha sin, bhain na heolaithe leas as caidreamh lidir le saornaigh tr cheardlanna, cruinnithe agus suirbhanna a dhanamh, a dirt Basagaa. Bh na saornaigh pirteach i ngach cim den taighde, lena n-irtear cinneadh a dhanamh faoi na ceisteanna taighde. Chuidigh s sin le hbharthacht shisialta gach staidir a chinnti, agus rinne s na tortha nos inmhnithe.

section.sectionTitle: Tuilleadh rannphirtochta a chur chun cinn
section.sectionBody:
Mairfidh CitieS-Health go dt Meitheamh 2022, agus t anails agus pl ndanamh fs ag Basagaa agus a fhoireann ar na sonra at ag teacht isteach. Mar sin fin, t roinnt ramhthortha ag teacht chun cinn: i staidar Barcelona fuarthas gaol idir leibhil truaillithe aeir agus feidhmocht aird agus strus a bhraitear.
I ngach cs, cuireadh bim ar an luach a bhaineann le rannphirtocht na saornach i ngach cim den taighde. Mar gheall ar rannphirtocht na saornach bh na treoirthionscadail sin nos bhartha do riachtanais an phobail itiil, chuir siad largas ar fil lenar cuireadh feabhas ar dhearadh na staidar, agus chuidigh siad linn na tortha a chur in il, a deir Basagaa. Baineann s sin leis an eolaocht a thabhairt nos gaire don tsocha.
T https://citizensciencetoolkit.eu/ (sraith uirlis idirghnomhacha deolaocht na saornach) forbartha leis an tionscadal chun cuidi le tionscadail a bheith ag pl le pobail agus dul i ngleic le saincheisteanna ar bhar leasa coitinn iad dibh. Cuimstear sampla agus acmhainn n tionscadal sa tsraith uirlis, chomh maith le leideanna maidir le staidar taighde faoi thionchar saornach a dhearadh agus sonra a bhaili.
T ranng ar shuomh grasin an tionscadail chomh maith trna fidir le haon duine a oibronn ar https://citieshealth.eu/get-involved/ (tionscadail rannphirtochta) beala nua a mholadh chun pirt a thabhairt do na saornach san eolaocht, a deir Basagaa. T s beartaithe againn freisin pipar a fhoilsi ar na ceachtanna a foghlaimodh CitieS-Health. Tthar ag sil go mbeidh s sin ar fad sideach do thionscadail um eolaocht na saornach at le teacht.

article.keywords: CitieS-Health, uirbeach, truailli, tionsclaocht, aer, slinte, bithmhais, stl mhaireachtla

article.title: Eolaocht na saornach: Sampla spreagla de rannphirtocht na socha le haghaidh Fhs Eorpach
article.teaser: T an acmhainn le heolaocht na saornach, a gcomhoibronn saornaigh le heolaithe ar thaighde agus nulaocht ina leith, feabhas a chur ar bharr feabhais agus ar thionchar an taighde agus an gaol idir an eolaocht agus an tsocha a neart. Lirtear sa Results Pack seo 12 thionscadal arna maoini ag an AE lena bhforbratear an dea-chleachtais chomh maith leis na hacmhainn agus na lonra a theastaonn chun comhoibri rathil a choth le saornaigh ar fud na hEorpa a fhorbairt.

article.title: Folkesundhed: At stte borgerne i stand til at overvge byforurening
article.teaser: Det EU-finansierede CitieS-Health-projekt stter borgernes bekymringer i centrum for forskning i folkesundhed og bymiljet. Resultaterne understreger fordelene ved at inddrage lokalsamfund.

section.sectionBody:
Nr man bor i byen, kan man nyde godt at den nemme adgang til beskftigelsesmuligheder, kulturelle aktiviteter og transportforbindelser, men der kan ogs vre visse ulemper. Bymiljer har oftere hjere luft- og stjforurening end landdistrikter, og der er som regel frre grnne omrder.
For at kunne undersge bymiljers indvirkning p helbredet ordentligt, skal vi kunne estimere personlig eksponering for disse risikofaktorer, forklarer projektkoordinator i https://citieshealth.eu/ (CitieS-Health) (Citizen Science for Urban Environment and Health) Xavier Basagaa fra https://www.isglobal.org/en (Barcelona Institute for Global Health) i Spanien. Det kan vre svrt for forskere at mle selv. Der skal ogs tages hjde for vigtige oplysninger som for eksempel fysisk aktivitet eller andre personlige vaner.
Anerkendelse af denne udfordring har frt til mere borgerinddragelse i videnskabsprojekter vedrrende byer i de seneste par r, og offentligheden er blevet bedt om at deltage i kampagner til overvgning af luftkvaliteten eller stjniveauet.
Alligevel mente vi, at citizen science ikke var blevet udnyttet godt nok til at evaluere sammenhngen mellem miljeksponeringer og helbred, siger Basagaa. Det var det vigtigste ml med CitieS-Health.

CitieS-Health-projektet blev ssat i januar 2019 og krte i fem europiske byer. Hver by havde sit eget studie, som fokuserede p et emne relateret til sundhed og bymiljet: luftforurening, afbrnding af biomasse, stjforurening, forurening fra industrien/erhvervsvirksomheder og byplanlgning.
I Barcelona hjalp borgerne med at udforme et studie i, hvordan forurening kan pvirke den mentale sundhed. Omkring 300 borgere leverede ca. 2500 mlinger af kognition og velvre p forskellige dage. Disse blev derefter sammenlignet med luftforureningskoncentrationer, som borgerne havde vret med til at overvge med personlige slanger til indsamling af https://www.epa.gov/no2-pollution (nitrogendioxid).
I Lucca i Italien frte en undersgelse blandt 1025 indbyggere i Serchio-dalen til beslutningen om at fokusere p kronisk nyresygdom. Til dato er 367 indbyggere blevet interviewet om deres beskftigelse, kost og livsstil, og 353 har doneret biologiske prver.
Andre studier s p, hvordan stj pvirker helbredet (Ljubljana i Slovenien) og afbrnding af biomasse og helbred (Amsterdam i Nederlandene) samt p forbindelsen mellem den opfattede miljkvalitet, fysisk aktivitet og stress (Kaunas i Litauen).
I hver af disse byer havde forskerne en strk interaktion med borgerne via workshops, mder og sprgeundersgelser, fortller Basagaa. Borgerne var med i alle faserne i forskningen, ogs faststtelse af forskningssprgsmlene. P denne mde kunne man sikre de enkelte studiers samfundsmssige relevans, og det gjorde resultaterne lettere at fortolke.

CitieS-Health krer indtil juni 2022, og Basagaa og hans team er stadig i gang med at analysere og drfte de indkommende data. Ikke desto mindre er nogle forelbige resultater ved at tage form: Barcelona-studiet opdagede en forbindelse mellem luftforureningsniveauer og opmrksomhedsgrad og opfattet stress.
I alle projekter er vrdien af borgerinddragelse i alle faser af forskning blevet understreget. Borgerdeltagelse gjorde disse pilotprojekter mere relevante for lokalsamfundenes behov, gav indsigter, som gjorde udformningen af studierne bedre, og de hjalp os med at formidle resultaterne, tilfjer Basagaa. Det handler om at bringe videnskaben tttere p samfundet.
Projektet har udviklet en interaktiv https://citizensciencetoolkit.eu/ (citizen science-vrktjskasse) p nettet, som hjlper projekterne med at inddrage lokalsamfundene og tackle flles problemer. Vrktjskassen indeholder eksempler og ressourcer fra projektet samt tips til udformning af borgerdrevne forskningsstudier og indsamling af data.
Projektets websted indeholder ogs et afsnit, hvor alle, der arbejder med https://citieshealth.eu/get-involved/ (deltagelsesprojekter), kan foresl nye mder at inddrage borgerne i videnskab p, fortller Basagaa. Vi planlgger desuden at udgive en rapport om de erfaringer, vi har fet i CitieS-Health. Alt dette vil forhbentligt kunne bruges i kommende citizen science-projekter.

article.keywords: CitieS-Health, byer, forurening, industri, luft, sundhed, biomasse, livsstil

article.title: Citizen science: Inspirerende eksempler p socialt engagement i Horisont Europa
article.teaser: Citizen science, hvor borgere samarbejder med forskere om forskning og innovation, rummer potentialet til at kunne forbedre kvaliteten og virkningerne af forskningen og styrke forholdet mellem videnskab og samfund. Denne Results Pack stter spotlys p 12 EU-finansierede projekter, som udvikler god praksis og opbygger de kapaciteter og netvrk, der er ndvendige for at fremme vellykkede samarbejder med borgere i hele Europa.

article.title: Sant publique: donner aux citoyens les moyens de surveiller la pollution urbaine
article.teaser: Le projet CitieS-Health, financ par lUE, place les proccupations des citoyens au cur de la recherche sur la sant publique et lenvironnement urbain. Ses rsultats soulignent les atouts dun engagement auprs des communauts locales.

section.sectionBody:
La vie en ville peut offrir des avantages en termes de facilit daccs aux possibilits demploi, aux activits culturelles et aux liaisons de transport, mais elle peut aussi avoir certains inconvnients. Les environnements urbains prsentent souvent des niveaux de pollution atmosphrique et de bruit plus levs que les zones rurales, et offrent moins despaces verts.
Pour tudier correctement limpact des environnements urbains sur la sant, nous devons tre en mesure destimer lexposition personnelle ces facteurs de risque, explique Xavier Basagaa, coordinateur du projet https://citieshealth.eu/ (CitieS-Health) (Citizen Science for Urban Environment and Health), du https://www.isglobal.org/en (Barcelona Institute for Global Health) en Espagne. Cela peut tre difficile mesurer par les seuls scientifiques. Des informations importantes, telles que lactivit physique ou dautres habitudes personnelles, doivent galement tre prises en compte.
La reconnaissance de ce dfi a conduit une plus grande implication des citoyens dans les projets scientifiques urbains au cours des dernires annes, le public tant appel participer des campagnes de surveillance de la qualit de lair ou du bruit.
Nous avons cependant eu le sentiment que la science citoyenne na pas t pleinement utilise pour valuer le lien entre les expositions environnementales et la sant, dclare Xavier Basagaa. Ctait lobjectif principal de CitieS-Health.

Lanc en janvier2019, le projet CitieS-Health sest droul dans cinq villes europennes. Une tude diffrente a t cre dans chacune delles, axe sur un sujet li la sant et lenvironnement urbain: pollution de lair, combustion de la biomasse, pollution sonore, pollution industrielle et design urbain.
Barcelone, les citoyens ont particip llaboration dune tude sur les effets de la pollution sur la sant mentale. Quelque 300citoyens ont fourni environ 2500mesures de la cognition et du bien-tre au cours de diffrentes journes. Ces mesures ont ensuite t compares aux concentrations de pollution atmosphrique que les citoyens avaient contribu surveiller, laide de tubes collecteurs personnels de https://www.epa.gov/no2-pollution (dioxyde dazote).
Lucques, en Italie, une enqute mene auprs de 1025rsidents de la valle du Serchio a conduit la dcision de se concentrer sur linsuffisance rnale chronique. ce jour, 367rsidents ont t interrogs sur leur profession, leur rgime alimentaire et leur mode de vie, et 353 ont fourni des chantillons biologiques.
Dautres tudes ont port sur limpact du bruit sur la sant (Ljubljana, Slovnie) et sur la combustion de la biomasse et la sant (Amsterdam, Pays-Bas), ainsi que sur les liens entre la perception de la qualit de lenvironnement, lactivit physique et le stress (Kaunas, Lituanie).
Dans chacune de ces villes, les scientifiques ont bnfici dune forte interaction avec les citoyens via des ateliers, des runions et la ralisation denqutes, note Xavier Basagaa. Les citoyens ont t impliqus dans toutes les phases de la recherche, y compris dans le choix des questions de recherche. Cela a permis de garantir la pertinence sociale de chaque tude et de rendre les rsultats plus faciles interprter.

CitieS-Health se droule jusquen juin2022, et Xavier Basagaa et son quipe sont encore en train danalyser les donnes entrantes et den discuter. Nanmoins, certains rsultats prliminaires mergent dj: ltude de Barcelone a observ un lien entre les niveaux de pollution atmosphrique et les performances en terme dattention ainsi que le stress peru.
Dans chaque cas, la valeur de la participation des citoyens toutes les phases de la recherche a t souligne. La participation des citoyens a permis de mieux adapter ces projets pilotes aux besoins des communauts locales, de fournir des informations qui ont amlior la conception des tudes et de nous aider communiquer les rsultats, ajoute Xavier Basagaa. Il sagit de rapprocher la science de la socit.
Le projet a dvelopp une https://citizensciencetoolkit.eu/ (bote outils pour la science citoyenne) interactive en ligne afin daider les projets sengager auprs des communauts et aborder les questions dintrt commun. La bote outils contient des exemples et des ressources du projet, ainsi que des conseils sur la conception dtudes de recherche et la collecte de donnes menes par des citoyens.
Le site web du projet contient galement une section par le biais de laquelle toute personne travaillant sur des https://citieshealth.eu/get-involved/ (projets participatifs) peut suggrer de nouvelles faons dimpliquer les citoyens dans la science, explique Xavier Basagaa. Nous prvoyons galement de publier un document sur les enseignements tirs de CitieS-Health. Tout cela sera, nous lesprons, utile pour les prochains projets de science citoyenne.

article.keywords: CitieS-Health, urbain, pollution, industriel, air, sant, biomasse, mode de vie

category.description: Ce traceur suit la contribution financire du programme Horizon Europe lattnuation du changement climatique (par exemple, les contributions la rduction des missions de gaz effet de serre) et ladaptation au changement climatique par le renforcement de la rsilience (par exemple, les inondations, les scheresses, lamnagement du territoire et une meilleure gouvernance, ladaptation au changement climatique dans les chanes de valeur, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversit
category.description: Ce traceur suit la contribution financire du programme Horizon Europe la restauration de la biodiversit en Europe (y compris la protection des espces, la conservation des cosystmes et la rhabilitation des habitats, tous essentiels la rsilience en matire dadaptation au climat et aux services cosystmiques), mais aussi la criminalit environnementale et au lien entre la sant et lenvironnement.
